title: Does a single volcanic emission release release a quantity of CO2 like all humans to date?
subtitle: Regardless of how they are looked at, the amount of CO2 released from volcanoes is much lower than the amount released from human sources on human time scales.
author: Alex Kasprak
vclaim: One eruption of a volcano that places 10,000 times more carbon dioxide in the atmosphere than all human activity throughout history.
